intro: Chelonopsis odontochila var. smithii, commonly known as the Smith's toothed thistle, is a rare and distinctive plant species native to specific regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and foliage with a spiny texture. The plant features robust, upright stems covered in dense, woolly hairs, and its leaves are typically lance-shaped with serrated edges. It produces yellow flowers arranged in a single head, which bloom in late summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
